before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"7hioi","text":"Wear protective gloves before handling blood or stool specimens","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9pap7","text":"Collect stool in a dry, sterilized, wide mouthed container/vial","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4cloh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"54nhj","text":"To determine the prevalence of anaemia in children aged 6-24 months living in a high malaria transmission setting in Burundi, we used laboratory protocols to test anaemia using a portable hemocue analyser and screend for malaria using a Malaria Ag Pf/Pan rapid test; a rapid, qualitative test for the detection of HRP-II (Histidine rich protein II- HRP-2). We also detected Soil-Transmitted Helminthiasis and other faecal parasites microscopically by wet preparation and Kato-Katz technique. Laboratory protocols were used in cross-sectional that determined the prevalence and factors associated with anaemia in children aged 6-24 months living in a high malaria transmission setting in northern Burundi. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.grant_id: Fogarty International Center (Emerging Global Leader Award grant number K43TW010365

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"4raft","text":"1.WHO: Bench aids for the diagnosis of intestinal parasites. Geneva: World Health Organization, 1994. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":52}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3h8h","text":"2.WHO: Public report, Product: SD Bioline Malaria Ag P.f and SD BIOLINE Malaria Ag P.f POCT. In Prequalification of Diagnostics Programme; 2016.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":85},{"style":"italic","offset":96,"length":41}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmkkj","text":"3.Clinical and Laboratory Standards Institute: Reference and Selected Procedures for the Quantitative Determination of Hemoglobin in Blood; Approved Standard—Third Edition, H15-A3, Vol. 20 No. 28, Pennsylvania, USA, 2000; [(accessed on 28 January 2021); Available online:  https://webstore.ansi.org/preview-pages/CLSI/preview_H15-A3.pdf]","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":47,"length":110}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":273,"length":63}],"data":{}},{"key":"34kli","text":"4.Swiss Tropical Institute: KATO-Katz technique for helminth eggs. Basel, 2005","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":28,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"FEC157D3850811EC99D00A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://webstore.ansi.org/preview-pages/CLSI/preview_H15-A3.pdf"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9l155","text":"Open the alcohol swab and Clean the patient’s 4th finger towards the side of the pulp (if the subject is right-handed, choose the 4th finger on the left hand and vice-versa) or a heel prick in the case of children age 6-11 months, and allow it to air dry.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dqr9u","text":"After the test packet opened, the test cassette was removed and labelled with subject’s code number ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cnbj9","text":"After using the alcohol swab, place it on its wrapper and set it aside, it may be used again to stop the bleeding after collecting the subject’s’ blood.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fb67o","text":"A positive results was recorded when the test and control bands appeared after 15 minutes and a negative results when only the control band showed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"506s2","text":"Wait for 15 minutes after adding assay diluent and read test results","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dh2c7","text":"Open the sterile lancet and prick the 4th finger (or a heel prick in the case of children age 6-11 months).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":39,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3fhmh","text":"A collect amount of blood was collected using the capillary tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"a7cb","text":"The blood sample was pipetted into the round hole of the RDT.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5d6be","text":"Place four drops of assay diluent vertically into the square hole of the cassette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: WET MOUNT PREPARATION OF STOOL SAMPLE FOR MICROSCOPY
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eif5n","text":"Take samples with a wooden applicator from different places in the faeces sample (collected in a sterile container).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: WET MOUNT PREPARATION OF STOOL SAMPLE FOR MICROSCOPY
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bedqg","text":"Place a drop of saline solution and one drop of Lugol’s Iodine solution on a labelled and clean microscopy slide (subject’s code number, date and hour)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: WET MOUNT PREPARATION OF STOOL SAMPLE FOR MICROSCOPY
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"50f9u","text":"Place the collected faeces specimen on the drops of solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: WET MOUNT PREPARATION OF STOOL SAMPLE FOR MICROSCOPY
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"el69d","text":"Dissociate the faeces and remove harmful debris with an applicator if necessary.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: WET MOUNT PREPARATION OF STOOL SAMPLE FOR MICROSCOPY
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"56hok","text":"Cover with a coverslip, pressing lightly to avoid air bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: READING AND REPORTING FAECAL PARASITES FROM WET PREPARATION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fuf1t","text":"Analyze the stool on the day of production and collection","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: READING AND REPORTING FAECAL PARASITES FROM WET PREPARATION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dc42b","text":"Macroscopic examination:  colour, consistency, blood, mucous, parts of parasite and adult parasite","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: READING AND REPORTING FAECAL PARASITES FROM WET PREPARATION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d52g4","text":"Microscope calibration using ocular micrometer disk","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: READING AND REPORTING FAECAL PARASITES FROM WET PREPARATION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b9856","text":"10X magnification objective: systematic examination of the preparation to detect helminthes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: READING AND REPORTING FAECAL PARASITES FROM WET PREPARATION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d18cd","text":"40X magnification objective: accurate identification of faecal parasites found at the 10X objective.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: READING AND REPORTING FAECAL PARASITES FROM WET PREPARATION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ds2s1","text":"Microscopic examination to detect ova (eggs) or larvae of Soil-Transmitted Helminthiasis (STH) or any faecal parasite.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: READING AND REPORTING FAECAL PARASITES FROM WET PREPARATION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7p2ec","text":"Report the nature of sol-transmitted helminthiasis or any faecal parasite on the laboratory report form. Report the result “POSITIVE” or “NEGATIVE”. If the result is POSITIVE, report the species of the detected parasites.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c8gs","text":"PREPARATION OF THIN SMEAR ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8f38","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3iphi","text":"Cut hydrophilic cellophane into 25mm x 30mm pieces and soak them in 50% Glycerol-Malachite Green (or Methylene Blue solution) for at least 24 hours before use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8gq0d","text":"Cut hydrophilic cellophane into 25mm x 30mm pieces and soak them in 50% Glycerol-Malachite Green (or Methylene Blue solution) for at least 24 hours before use. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dfv27","text":"Label microscopic glass slide with the subject’s code number.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"aume7","text":"Transfer a small amount of stool onto a piece of scrap paper","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cmu41","text":"Press nylon screen on top of faecal sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2p12d","text":"Using flat-sided of a wooden applicator stick, scrape across the upper surface of the screen the sifted faecal material so that only debris remains.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7rh0q","text":"Place a template on a labelled microscope slide and transfer a small amount of sieved faecal material through the template and carefully fill the hole. Level with the applicator stick. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a7usj","text":"Remove the template vertically and carefully (avoid any horizontal movement) so that all the faecal material is left on the slide and none is left sticking to the template. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"36hu1","text":"Cover the faecal sample on the slide with a glycerol-soaked cellophane strip, wipe off any excess of glycerol-malachite green solution on the upper surface of the cellophane with a small piece of absorbent tissue. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8lj6b","text":"Invert the microscope slide and press the faecal sample against the cellophane on a smooth surface (a second clean microscope slide or a clean applicator) to spread the sample evenly. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"49q75","text":"Do not lift the slide straight up. The cellophane may separate. Gently slide the microscope slide sideways holding the cellophane. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7nnkr","text":"READING AND REPORTING OF FAECAL PARASITES","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bd9tq","text":"The slide should be read within 30-60 minutes. To read the slide, place it under the microscope using the 40 and 100x magnification objectives.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e28sj","text":"Read all fields on the slide using the vertical 'zig zag' system and the tally counter to record how many eggs are seen under the slide as it is read.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"itdt","text":"Record the number and nature of each egg on a recording form next to the sample number. Multiply by the appropriate number to give number of eggs per gram of faeces: by 24 for a 41.7mg template. If there are no eggs, score \"0\". ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bp6n9","text":"The recorded result was the hemoglobin value is displayed after 5 seconds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bfm4q","text":"Haemoglobin was measured by placing the microcuvette in the cuvette holder, gently sliding the cuvette holder to measuring position.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"861vv","text":"Fill the microcuvette completely with blood in one step and make sure that no specimen is drawn out from the open end by wiping off specimen from the outside","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dcsjm","text":"After wiping away the first 2 or 3 drops of blood. The fingertip is lightly pressed until a collect amount of blood appears","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ae33c","text":"Open the sterile lancet and prick the 4th finger (or a heel prick in the case of children age 6-11 months). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":39,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eavno","text":"After using the alcohol swab, place it on its wrapper and set it aside, it may be used again to stop the bleeding after collecting the subject’s’ blood.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"67mlr","text":"Clean the patient’s 4th finger towards the side of the pulp (if the subject is right-handed, choose the 4th finger on the left hand and vice-versa)or a heel prick in the case of children age 6-11 months, and allow it to air dry.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"t3it","text":"Open the alcohol swab","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3b7bd","text":"Preparation of the patient’s site to prick ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"81rnm","text":"1.Switch-on the HemoCue Hb 301 analyser. Check if the vial of HemoCue Hb 301 is empty. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3rnju","text":"Report the result “POSITIVE” or “NEGATIVE”. If the result is POSITIVE, report the species of the detected parasites.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: LABORATORY PROTOCOLS OF ANAEMIA TESTING USING PORTABLE HEMOCUE, MALARIA SCREENING USING RDT (HRP-2), PROCESSING OF WET PREPARATION,  KATO-KATZ  AND EXAMINATION OF STOOL SAMPLES, REPORTING OF SOIL-TRANSMITTED HELMINTHES AND FAECAL PARASITES (PREVALENCE AND

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"9grg3","text":"Disposal all used materials and remaining stool samples according to the laboratory safety rules","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
